step1.title: User Agreement
step1.text1: A project contains your downloads and the documentation for your plugin.
step1.text2: Before continuing, please review the Hangar Submission Guideline.

step2.title: Basic Settings
step2.description: Provide the basic settings for this project.

step3.title: Additional Settings
step3.description: Optional: You can provide these additional settings, or change them in your project settings at any time after the project creation.

step4.title: Import from Spigot
step4.description: Optional: You can convert an existing description for your project from the Spigot resource forums. You can safely skip this and design your description from scratch once you created the project.

tutorialInstructions.line1: To get the BBCode of your Spigot project, do the following:
tutorialInstructions.line2: 1. Go to your project and click on "Edit Resource".
tutorialInstructions.line3: 2. Click on the wrench symbol in the description editor.
tutorialInstructions.line4: 3. Copy paste the new contents into the upper converter textbox, do changes to the output if you like, and hit save!

error.create: There was an error creating the project
error.nameExists: A project with this name already exists
error.slugExists: A project with this slug already exists
error.tooLongSponsors: Project sponsor box is too long

settings.title: Settings
settings.categorySub: Categorize your project into one of 10 categories. Appropriately categorizing your project makes it easier for people to find.
settings.keywordsSub: These are special words that will return your project when people add them to their searches.
settings.homepageSub: Having a custom homepage for your project helps you look more proper, official, and gives you another place to gather information about your project.
settings.issuesSub: Providing an issue tracker helps your users get support more easily and provides you with an easy way to track bugs.
settings.sourceSub: Support the community of developers by making your project open source!
settings.supportSub: An external place where you can offer support to your users. Could be a forum, a Discord server, or somewhere else.
settings.wikiSub: An external place where you can offer additional documentation to your users.
settings.licenseSub: What can people do (and not do) with your project?
settings.forumSub: Sets if events like a new release should automatically create a post on the forums
settings.descriptionSub: A short description of your project
settings.iconSub: Upload an image representative of your project.
settings.renameSub: Changing your project's name can have undesired consequences. We will not setup any redirects.
settings.deleteSub: Once you delete a project, it cannot be recovered.
settings.hardDeleteSub: Once you delete a project, it cannot be recovered. For real this time...

donation.enableSub: Enable the donation form for this project
donation.subject: PayPal email or hosted button id
donation.subjectSub: Enter your PayPal email here. Alternatively, you can setup a hosted button on PayPals Website and enter the hosted button id here.

manage.mainSubtitle: The most recent builds on the main stable channel will be provided in the download button in the project's header.
manage.title: Release channels
manage.reviewInfo: Channel names may automatically be flagged for review and will only be published after
manage.subtitle: Release channels represent the state of a plugin release. A project may have up to five release channels.

new.text: Organizations allow you to group users and provide closer collaboration between them within your projects on Hangar.
